intro: Piaranthus decorus subsp. cornutus, commonly known as the horned pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiky inflorescences that resemble a pincushion, with small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a popular subject in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
